page.title: 03The Creamery: Crudgington
page.content: The Dairy Crest creamery at Crudgington is the major industrial activity and employer in the block. It employs just over 300 workers, with the actual number depending on the seasonal variations in milk production, (maximum April/May). Milk is collected from 950 farmers by bulk tanker lorries, each carrying 900 litres. The catchment area ranges all over North Shropshire and parts of Staffordshire and Cheshire. The main products are butter and skimmed milk powder. The former is exported as far as malaysia, the Middle East and the West Indies. The latter is used not for local animal feed, especially pigs, but also exported, particularly to the Third World; Algeria, Peru and Mexico. Peak handling capacity is 1.3 million litres per day.
